areas.area:
Welcome to Purple CMS!

This is a very simple CMS that can drop into any ASP.NET 4.0 site and help manage lots of pages.

For more information, head to http://johndyer.name/

Getting Started

  • Click "Login" (username=admin, password=password) 
  • From any page click the "Edit" button and you'll see some editing controls where you can directly edit HTML or use a User Control (*.ascx).
  • From the home page, try click "Add Page" which will add another sub page to the site. It will then be added to the main menu.
  • You can also see the versions of the page by clicking "Versions"

How it Works

Purple CMS needs five (5) things to run

  • .NET Framework 4.0 (currently RC)
  • Purple.Core.dll in the /bin/ folder
  • A /cms/ folder with controls and data (see below)
  • An configuration entry in web.config
  • A Route in global.asax

By default, all pages, controls, and templates are stored in /cms/ and the content of the site is in /cms/content/. Everything else is yours to change.

  • /cms/content/masterpages/ - where normal ASP.NET masterpages live
  • /cms/content/controls/ - *.ascx controls you want to drop into pages
  • /cms/content/webpages/ - when using the XML provider, this is where your page data is stored
